intro: Adinobotrys nieuwenhuisii, commonly known as the African starfruit tree, is a tropical plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are similar in appearance to starfruit, though less commonly cultivated. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
